Loyal employees get the most satisfaction from a job well done. All they really need are opportunities to excel and appreciation. Agree ?
How Small Workplace Changes Can Make a Big Impact on Your Employees' Productivity
I don't think most people realize just how complicated digital marketing is.
Too many companies believe a Facebook Page and a blog will be enough to drive new customers and sales.
And what makes things harder for them is that the digital landscape is constantly changing.
Throw in the fact that digital marketing is a long-term strategy and you'll find most companies don't have the patience (or true understanding) to make the investment necessary to succeed.
There are a few things I always tell people about online marketing.
1. Marketing is not an expense/cost. It's an investment.
2. You will not see significant results in the short term. If an agency/consultant promises you this, run away.
3. Constantly study. There's nothing worse than falling behind new trends and necessities in the digital space.
4. Relentlessly test. You can always improve your tactics... even if they are already bringing you great results.
5. Be patient. Digital marketing is a marathon, not a sprint.
If you (or the people you work for) don't understand these five points, it will be incredibly difficult to grow your business.

Independent consultant to small businesses in online marketing, branding, and marketing strategy focused on improving business performance.•	Developed a strategic marketing plan for an assisted living center that included an online lead generation funnel with Google Pay-Per-Click and a special landing page resulting in two new residents and three referrals to sister sites.•	Improved product launch for a national marketing agency for financial/investment advisors and money managers, by developing a 22-point email nurture campaign using Infusionsoft driving 10 new sales, more than $80K, in one week.•	Launched an online dating website by writing press releases and implementing a social media campaign that was picked up by national media outlets increasing exposure and growing membership.•	Executed a process to track 12 sales executives’ performance improving efficiency, tracking performance more closely, and created better internal communications.

I have been working with Francis for the past year at National Bank of Arizona. He is an incredible coworker and always willing to help whenever needed. Francis has helped me with the social media campaign for our Taste of the Biltmore event. He has completely revamped the entire persona, voice, look & feel of our Instagram and Facebook pages. Francis’ has an incredible attention detail and is truly a wordsmith genius. He is constantly researching on top hashtags, which time/day to post give you the greatest reach and industry trends just to name of few. To top it all off, Francis is just a joy to work with. Everyday Francis has a smile on his face and brings such a positive attitude into the office. Francis receives my highest recommendation.

I have been working with Francis for a little more than a year and I can confidently say that you'd be hard-pressed to find a better copywriter, a digital strategist, and more importantly a leader than him. He just has a gift for capturing the audience with his genius writing. He continues to exceed not only my expectations but the entire National Bank of Arizona's marketing department on regular basis.It is quite common for Francis to be the first one at work and last one out. Francis has the type of fun and energetic personality that makes loving my job even more enjoyable. It is truly a pleasure to work with Francis.
